title: Prototype Diversified Voting Method
description: Can we implement a prototype demonstration of diversified voting and flexible funding for one challenge fund?

f6_assessments.q0:
Implementing a demonstration of diversified voting and flexible funding aligns with the Cardano mission driving adoption of Cardano however the challenge brief is more of a proposal than a challenge. The challenge brief is very specific in that it will require a prototype vote using recommendations from the Diversified Voting Influence analysis then provide an analysis of the results. By my understanding, it does not appear that there could be multiple winning proposals under this challenge, at best there might be competing teams for a single contract to do the work. 
I neither agree nor disagree that this challenge is critical to achieve Cardano's mission.
f6_assessments.q1:
The catalyst community has the technical capabilities to address the challenge however its not clear to me when and how the community chose to use the recommendations from the Diversified Voting Influence analysis as the desired voting methodology. I suppose voting for this challenge would give it legitimacy however in that case a link to the analysis and recommendations being made would be required for informed decision-making.
I neither agree nor disagree that the Catalyst community has the capacity to address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q2:
The success criteria are relevant to the challenge question.
The key metrics are relevant to the success criteria and some are measurable. 
I  agree that the success criteria and suggested metrics are set correctly to measure progress in addressing the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: I agree with this proposal because  I think that trying out a different way of voting, parallely with the current way would show if there was an advantage of having other ways of voting and whether that would make a difference in the number of projects accepted and rejected through voting
f6_assessments.q1: The budget for this project is reasonable .
f6_assessments.q2:
The Verifiability of this is clear. Metrics have been identified, a roadmap has been laid out to be carried out.
Metrics include 
No of votes for each proposal using each method of voting
how did smaller size wallets influence it
Does the flexible funding capability influence the selection of awarded projects
Are there any detectable security risks with this rebalanced influence
How does the participation in the prototype vote compare with the current Cardano Catalyst voting?

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal looks to experiment with the voting process in order to determine what is the best way to weigh wallets and voting. We want to make sure governance is fair and those with a larger stake have a larger say, but we also don't want smaller voices drowned out.
f6_assessments.q1: The community has the capacity to experiment with voting and different weighted voting mechanisms. We even have another proposed challenge called challenge governance that this could be combined with.
f6_assessments.q2: The criiteria and sugjesteed metrics are sufficient to measure the progress as they cover outcomes, measuring changed outcomes, security risks,  and the effect on participation.

importance: Prior to implementing a modification to the Cardano Catalyst voting mechanism, a trial is necessary to test the proposed recommendations.
success:
25% of the voting wallets participate in the prototype vote.

The results demonstrate important differences in selected projects.
